intro: Mucizonia hispida, commonly known as the rough mucilaginous plant, is a species belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are covered in fine, stiff hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruits are capsule-like structures containing numerous tiny seeds. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its unique adaptations, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
